intro: Rourea afzelii, commonly known as the African rourea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, round, fleshy fruits.
